intro: Galium nigricans f. antrorsum, commonly known as the blacknight bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, often fragrant flowers. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
